body_html:
@kwotsin your nvcc --version actually posted the full release code: V8.0.33
If possible, I would strongly recommend upgrading to the latest cuda version, >= V8.0.64, since there are known issues with the older versions.

for those interested in the jetson progress:
I've also successful built TF v1.1.0 (1ec6ed5) on the TX2 using CUDA V8.0.64 with bazel 0.5.1.

I followed the EXACT same process as I did on my TX1, and as far as I can tell, I suspect the only major difference points to the difference in CUDA version.

Specifically for the TX1 / TX2 platform, I still had to patch TF v1.1.0 by making the modifications in lines 65 to 75 here: https://github.com/jetsonhacks/installTensorFlowTX2/blob/master/patches/tensorflow.patch

I was then able to import tensorflow into python and run some basic test code to validate the installation.
body_text:
@kwotsin your nvcc --version actually posted the full release code: V8.0.33
If possible, I would strongly recommend upgrading to the latest cuda version, >= V8.0.64, since there are known issues with the older versions.
for those interested in the jetson progress:
I've also successful built TF v1.1.0 (1ec6ed5) on the TX2 using CUDA V8.0.64 with bazel 0.5.1.
I followed the EXACT same process as I did on my TX1, and as far as I can tell, I suspect the only major difference points to the difference in CUDA version.
Specifically for the TX1 / TX2 platform, I still had to patch TF v1.1.0 by making the modifications in lines 65 to 75 here: https://github.com/jetsonhacks/installTensorFlowTX2/blob/master/patches/tensorflow.patch
I was then able to import tensorflow into python and run some basic test code to validate the installation.
body:
@kwotsin your nvcc --version actually posted the full release code: V8.0.33 
If possible, I would strongly recommend upgrading to the latest cuda version, >= V8.0.64, since there are known issues with the older versions.

for those interested in the jetson progress:
I've also successful built TF v1.1.0 (1ec6ed51182adf8f1b03a3188c16cd8a45ca6c85) on the TX2 using CUDA V8.0.64 with bazel 0.5.1. 

I followed the EXACT same process as I did on my TX1, and as far as I can tell, I suspect the only major difference points to the difference in CUDA version.

Specifically for the TX1 / TX2 platform, I still had to patch TF v1.1.0 by making the modifications in lines 65 to 75 here: https://github.com/jetsonhacks/installTensorFlowTX2/blob/master/patches/tensorflow.patch

I was then able to import tensorflow into python and run some basic test code to validate the installation.
